Name: Requiring the DOC to report on sexual assault and sexual harassment of correctional staff and providing staff access to mental health treatment resources.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of correction to report on sexual assault and sexual harassment of correctional staff and providing staff access to mental health treatment resources

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Criminal Justice
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Amended by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council

Attachments.Name: Minutes of the Stated Meeting - March 19, 2024

Summary: This bill would require the Department of Correction (DOC) to report on alleged incidents of sexual assault and sexual harassment by incarcerated individuals against staff working in City jails.  For each incident, DOC would be required to report information related to the alleged incident and related investigation. The bill would also require the DOC to ensure that staff have access to mental health resources relating to reducing stress and other adverse mental health impacts for persons working in correctional facilities.

\ul\v0\par
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj Section 1. Chapter 1 of title 9 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding new sections 9-156.1 and 9-156.2 to read as follows: \par
\ul\'a7 9-156.1 Reporting on sexual assault and sexual harassment of staff. \par
a. Definitions. For purposes of this section, the following terms have the following meanings:\par
Commissioner. The term \ldblquote commissioner\rdblquote  means the commissioner of correction.\par
Correctional health services. The term \ldblquote correctional health services\rdblquote  has the same meaning as set forth in section 9-108.\par
Department. The term \ldblquote department\rdblquote  means the department of correction.\par
Gender identity. The term \ldblquote gender identity\rdblquote  has the same meaning as set forth in section 9-165.\par
Personal information. The term \ldblquote personal information\rdblquote  has the same meaning as set forth in subdivision a of section 10-501.\par
Reporting period. The term \ldblquote reporting period\rdblquote  means January 1 through June 30 of a year, or July 1 through December 31 of a year. \par
Sexual assault of staff. The term \ldblquote sexual assault of staff\rdblquote  means any non-consensual physical conduct of a sexual nature by an incarcerated individual toward or against staff, including but not limited to patting, rubbing, kissing, grabbing, pinching, or touching. \par
Sexual harassment of staff. The term \ldblquote sexual harassment of staff\rdblquote  means any of the following acts conducted by an incarcerated individual toward or against staff: (i) verbal comments or obscene gestures of a sexual nature, including sexually suggestive remarks, jokes, innuendos or leering; (ii) intentional touching of the incarcerated individual\rquote s own body in plain view of staff, in a manner that demonstrates it is for the purpose of sexual arousal, gratification, annoyance, or offense; and (iii) any act made by an incarcerated individual to request, solicit, or otherwise encourage staff to engage in sexual activity. \par
Staff. The term \ldblquote staff\rdblquote  means a natural person, other than an incarcerated individual, who works directly for the department or correctional health services.\par
b. Incident report. No later than February 15, 2026, and every 6 months thereafter, the department shall submit to the mayor, the speaker of the council, and the board of correction a report on alleged incidents of sexual assault of staff and sexual harassment of staff that occurred, or for which an investigation was pending, \cf1 during the preceding reporting period\cf0 .\cf1\f1\fs20  \cf0\f0\fs24 All data in such report shall be reported in a machine-readable format. Such report shall include a table with information about each alleged incident of sexual assault of staff or sexual harassment of staff that occurred during the preceding reporting period in each row. Such information shall include, but need not be limited to:\ulnone\par
\ul 1. A unique identification number for such incident; \par
2. Whether the incident related to an allegation of sexual assault of staff, and if so, any specific alleged conduct that violated the department\rquote s person in custody rulebook; \par
3. Whether the incident related to an allegation of sexual harassment, and if so, any specific alleged conduct that violated the department\rquote s person in custody rulebook; \par
4. The month in which such incident occurred;\par
5. Whether the staff who was the alleged victim of such incident was civilian or uniformed staff at the time of such incident;\par
6. Whether such incident took place between the times of 7:00 a.m. and 3:00 p.m., 3:00 p.m. and 11:00 p.m., or 11:00 p.m. and 7:00 a.m.;\par
7. The gender identity of the staff who was the alleged victim of such incident;\par
8. The gender identity of the alleged perpetrator of such incident; \par
9. The facility of the department in which such incident occurred;\par
10. Whether such incident occurred in a service area or housing area of such facility;\par
11. For any such incident that occurred in a housing area, the type of housing area;\par
12. Whether the department\rquote s video camera surveillance recorded such incident; \par
13. Whether the department collected any physical evidence from or related to such incident;\par
14. Whether the department assisted the staff who was the alleged victim of such incident in obtaining a rape kit following the incident, including, but not limited to, by making referrals for treatment or providing stipends; \ulnone\par
\ul 15. The number of days between such incident and the date such incident was reported to the department;\par
16. Whether the department opened an investigation of such incident, and, if so, the number of days between such incident and the date the department opened such investigation;\par
17. Whether the alleged perpetrator and the alleged victim were separated from physical contact during the pendency of such investigation;\par
18. \cf2 Whether such investigation is pending or has been closed at the time of submission of such report;\par
19. The outcome of any investigation related to the alleged incident, including but not limited to, any discipline or penalties imposed on the alleged perpetrator;  \par
\cf0 20. Whether the department referred such incident to the district attorney, and if so, the number of days between such incident and the date the department made such referral; \par
21. Whether the alleged perpetrator of such incident was re-arrested following the incident, and if so, the number of days between such incident and such arrest; and\par
22. Whether the alleged victim was notified regarding the outcome of any investigation related to the incident.\par
c. In accordance with applicable law, correctional health services shall assist the department in collecting the information required to be reported under this section.  \par
d. Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the report required by subdivision b shall not be transmitted in electronic format to the department of records and information services or made available to the public on or through such department\rquote s website. \par
\'a7 9-156.2 Mental health resources for correctional staff. \par
a. Definitions. For purposes of this section, the following terms have the following meanings:\par
Commissioner. The term \ldblquote commissioner\rdblquote  means the commissioner of correction.\par
Sexual assault of staff. The term \ldblquote sexual assault of staff\rdblquote  means any non-consensual physical conduct of a sexual nature by an incarcerated individual toward or against staff, including but not limited to patting, rubbing, kissing, grabbing, pinching, or touching.  \par
Sexual harassment of staff. The term \ldblquote sexual harassment of staff\rdblquote  means any of the following acts conducted by an incarcerated individual toward or against staff: (i) verbal comments or obscene gestures of a sexual nature, including sexually suggestive remarks, jokes, innuendos or leering; (ii) intentional touching of the incarcerated individual\rquote s own body in plain view of staff, in a manner that demonstrates it is for the purpose of sexual arousal, gratification, annoyance, or offense; and (iii) any act made by an incarcerated individual to request, solicit, or otherwise encourage staff to engage in sexual activity.  \par
Staff. The term \ldblquote staff\rdblquote  means an individual, other than an incarcerated individual, who works directly for the department.\par
b. The department shall provide to staff access to mental health resources relating to reducing stress and other adverse mental health impacts for persons working in correctional facilities. In providing such access, the department shall consider guidance and any best practices established by the national institute of corrections. Such resources shall include, but need not be limited to, confidential mental health counseling to address the impacts of sexual assault of staff and sexual harassment of staff.\par
c. The commissioner shall provide information about the availability of such resources on the department\rquote s website. The commissioner shall electronically communicate such information to staff, and shall post such information in conspicuous locations in facilities of the department.\par
\ulnone\'a7 2. This local law takes effect 120 days after it becomes law.\ul\par
\pard\ltrpar\noline\qj\ulnone\fs18 JEF/JDK\par
